intF_tria3.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : intF_tria3.c                                                    *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Computes the integral of the Maxwell Stress Tensor for one element and      *
00009 * returns the integrals in vector Int[] for the three spatial dimentions.     *
00010 * Works for linear interpolation in triangular elements (3-noded triangles).  *
00011 * Int[0] = Fx    |    Int[1] = Fy    |    Int[2] = Fz                         * 
00012 ******************************************************************************/
00013 
00014 /******************************************************************************
00015 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00016 *                                                                             *
00017 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00018 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *

00023 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *
00024 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00025 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00026 *                                                                             *
00027 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00028 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00029 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00030 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00031 *                                                                             *
00032 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00033 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00034 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00035 ******************************************************************************/
00036 
00037 #include "integral_tria3.h"
00038 
00039 int intF_tria3(double X[3][3], double E[3][3], double *Int)
00040 {
00041     unsigned int i;
00042     double A, Ex, Ey, Ez, J, W, Esq, NE;
00043     double L[2], N[3], normal[3], XL[3];
00044 
00045     /* Initialize */
00046     Int[0] = Int[1] = Int[2] = 0.0;  
00047 
00048     /* Integrate using Gauss-Legendre quadrature */
00049     for(i = 0; i < TNGAUSS; i++){
00050         L[0] = TGauss[i][0];
00051         L[1] = TGauss[i][1];
00052         W = TGauss[i][2];
00053     
00054         /* Shape functions N and Jacobian J for these (L1,L2) values */
00055         shape_tria3(L,N);       
00056         J = X2L_tria3(X,XL,L,N);
00057         getLocalNormal_tria3(X,normal);
00058 
00059         /* Electric field value at this integration point */
00060         Ex = E[0][0]*N[0] + E[1][0]*N[1] + E[2][0]*N[2];
00061         Ey = E[0][1]*N[0] + E[1][1]*N[1] + E[2][1]*N[2];
00062         Ez = E[0][2]*N[0] + E[1][2]*N[1] + E[2][2]*N[2];
00063     
00064         /* Auxiliar quantities */
00065         NE = Ex*normal[0] + Ey*normal[1] + Ez*normal[2];
00066         Esq = Ex*Ex + Ey*Ey + Ez*Ez;
00067         A = J*W;
00068 
00069         /* Add contribution from this integration point */
00070         Int[0] += A*(Ex*NE - 0.5*Esq*normal[0]);
00071         Int[1] += A*(Ey*NE - 0.5*Esq*normal[1]);
00072         Int[2] += A*(Ez*NE - 0.5*Esq*normal[2]);   
00073     }
00074 
00075     return 0;
00076 }
